title: View your driving licence information online

details.description: Find out what information the DVLA holds about your driving licence
details.alternative_title: What information does the DVLA hold about your driving licence?
details.more_information:
To use the online service you’ll need to have a photocard licence, which you applied for online.

What can you find out?

The following information is held on your records:

  • what sort of vehicles you can drive
  • details of any penalty points or fines
  • when your licence expires
  • your contact information
  • personal details, eg date and place of birth
details.introduction: You can use this service to find out what information the DVLA holds about your driving licence.
details.alternate_methods:
Ask for your driving licence information by post

To see what information the DVLA holds on your driving licence you should send the following information to the DVLA:

  • your full name and address
  • your driver licence number (or your date of birth if you don’t know your driver number)
  • a cheque or postal order for £5 payable to ‘DVLA, Swansea’

You should send this to:

Driver Licence Validation Service
CCG, D7
DVLA
Swansea
SA6 7JL

It’s a criminal offence to obtain someone else’s personal information without their permission.
